projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.head: ¶ Here after foloweth the newe pryuyleges and Indulgēces graunted by ou • holy Father the Pope Leo .x. to the houſe of ſeynt Thomas of Acres in London.
div.p: FIrſte that all & euery Cryſten man & woman beynge • ruely penytent & cōfeſſyd whiche yerely ſhall deuoutly vyſyt the ſayd The ſtacyons of Rome. Hoſpytall on Aſſhe wednyſday / & .ii. dayes immedyatly next folowynge on Shere thurſdaye / & two dayes imediatly nexte enſuynge / Alſo in the feſtes of the tranſlacyon & matterdome of Seynt Thomas the martyr / and in the euyns of the ſame feſtes puttynge to theyr helpynge handes vnto the reparacyon mayntaynynge and payeng of the dettes of the ſayd Hoſpytall in eyther of the feſtes aboue ſayd / and euyns of the ſame ſhall obtayne and haue as great & lyke pardon and Indulgence with remyſſyon of ſynnes as if they ꝑſonally ſhuld vyſyt the Churche at Rome named Scala celi / and all other churches and holy places of Rome within and without the ſayd Cytie of Rome / In euery daye of Lent & other tymes of the yere when the ſtacyōs of the ſayde Cytie within & without and Indulgence of the ſame are ſolempnyſed / And as if they had done & fulfylled all maner of thynges whiche ought to be fulfylled to obtayne the ſayd Iudulgence at Rome.

¶ Secondly that all Criſten people maye the ſooner obtayne the ſayde Indulgence and remyſſyons of ſynnes graunted to the for Power gyuen to the maſter & his depuy to aſſygne cōfeſſoures. ſayd hoſpytall our holy father the Pope aforeſayd hath graūted that it may be laufull to the ſayd mayſter of the ſayde Hoſpytall for the tyme beynge in the feſtes aboueſayd & euyns of the ſame to aſſygne & depute ſuffycyent Confeſſours ſeculer or reguler or bothe ſeculer & reguler to gyther whiche mayſter if he be a preeſt / & thyſe cōfeſſours ſo deputed by hym / or elles if he be no preeſt thyſe ſayde confeſſours by hym or by his laufull deputie ſo deputed / And choſen as often as ſhalbe neceſſary after they haue dylygently harde ye Confeſſions of the ſayd deuout People in theſe dayes / Feſtes / and Vigylles aforeſayd euery yere in the ſayd Hoſpytall may affoyle them ones in theyr lyfe of all & euery of theyr ſynnes crymes exceſſys and delictes howe ſo euer greuous & enorme they be / thoughe they be ſuche as are reſerued vnto the ſee of Rome excepte only thoſe whiche ben conteyned in the Bull whiche is red yerely at Rome on ſher thurſday / but in all other caſes not reſerued vnto the ſayd ſee of Rome the foreſayde confeſſours may affoyle an enioyne them holſome penaunce as often as nede ſhall requyre.

¶ Thyrdely that the ſaid Confeſſours ſoo deputyd as is aforeſaid by the Mayſter of the ſaid Hoſpitall may commute And tourne Commutacyō of vowes & releſynge of othes plenary remiſſion • nis • lyfe. auctorite to haue ā Aulter callyd altare portatili. all maner of vowes into other dedes of Charyte / the vowe to Iheruſalē / the vowe vnto ſeynt Peter and Poule of Rome the vowe vnto ſeynt Iames in Cōpoſtella / & alſo of Relygyon & chaſtyte oonly •• cept / alſo the ſayd cōfeſſours may releas all maner of oth • s.

¶ Alſo fourthly that the ſayd confeſſours may gyue vnto all criſten people beynge truely contryte and confeſſyd vyſytynge ye ſayd Hoſpytall in tyme aboueſayd plenare & full remyſſyon of all theyr ſynnes ones in theyr lyfe / & in poynt of deth.

¶ Alſo fyftly that hit ſhalbe laufull vnto the ſayde mayſter that nowe is and for the tyme ſhalbe / and to the Bretherne of the ſayde houſe / and to all other criſten people of eyther kynde / which for the tyme ſhall enter into the brethe • hed of Seynt Thomas the martyr that they may haue an Aulter called Altare portatile vpon the which with dewe reuerence and honour in places conuenyent and oneſt / ſoo it be withoute preiudyce of any other man / and alſo that / that the qualyte of theyr buſynes dothe inhaunce or fortune the ſayde mayſter and the foreſayde bretherne and ſuſterne may ſynge maſſe / or cauſe to be ſonge before daylyght / ſo that it be done aboutes the Day lyght.

¶ Prouyded alway that the ſayd mayſter and bretherne do not vſe to celebrat maſſe before Day lyghte accuſtomably / but only at certayne tymes and ſcacely for the reuerence of the bleſſyd ſacrament of the Alter.

¶ The ſyxte graunte is / if it happen any Brother / or ſuſter of the ſayde Fraternyte or Hoſpitall to come to any Churche interdicte Dyuyne ſeruyce may be ſayd and the ſacramentes mynyſtred in Tyme 〈…〉
by any ordynary auctoryte or power it ſhalbe laufull ſecretly the dores beynge ſhytte to mynyſter ſacramentes and to ſaye and here Maſſes and other dyuyne Seruyces by theym ſelfe if the ſayde Bretherne be preſtes or by any other preſte ſuffycyent ſeculer or reguler by them deputed / and alſo in tyme of ſuche interdiccyon to receyue & mynyſter the holy ſacrament of the aulter with other Sacramentes ſaue on Eſter daye without preiudyce of any other perſon in preſence of the ſayd Bretherne and Suſters / and in the •
ſence of them 〈◊〉 ſeruauntes and theyr frendes / ſoo that thoſe Bretherne and Suſterne and other ſuche here ••
〈…〉

〈…〉 to 〈…〉 to 〈…〉
• he ſayd auctorite ſo it be 〈…〉
〈…〉 may be ••• yed in Tyme of interdiccyon. perpetually may be obſerued and kepte inuyolate / oure ſayde holy Father Pope Leo aboue named ▪ hathe n •• ed and 〈…〉 the moſte reuerent Father in god the Lorde archebyſſhope of caunterbury Primate of Englande. And alſo the reuerende Fade • s in god the lordes Byſſhoppes of London and Nor whytche now beynge / and that hereafter ſhalbe perpetually to be protectoures & defendours of the ſayd Hoſpytall and of the aboue reherſed Indulgences and pryuyleges lyke as it is more fully conteyned in the letters of his holyneſſe therupon made vnder leed.

¶ Alſo our holy Father aboueſayd hath confyrmed and ratyfyed all maner of lyberties / Immunytyes & Indulgens graūted by his • deceſſours Popes of Rome vnto the foreſayd hoſpitall Mayſter and bretherne of acon̄ in London. Whiche pryuyleges / indulgēces and immunytes hereafter dothe folowe.

¶ Firſte our holy fader Alexander the fourthe of that Name ſomtyme Pope of Rome graciouſly hath releſyd to all cryſten people The vii. ꝑte of penaūce releaſed. A cōmaūdmēt to all • lates. In the tyme of interdiccyō dyuyne ſeruyce may be ſayd ones ī the yere. that doeth helpe or releue y• ſayd place with theyr goodes or almes / or do take fraternyte of the ſayd place & yerely to the ſame ony Benefyte gyue or pay / the .vii. parte of penaunce enioyned.

¶ Alſo our holy father Benet the .xii. of ye name ſomtyme Pope of Rome cōmaūdeth all prelates to ſuffre the ꝑcuratours of ye ſayd place to pronoūce and frely expowne theyr nedes and Indulgences in theyr ſayde Churche to the Clergie & other cōmune people.

¶ Alſo if the ſayde procuratours come into ony Cyte Caſtell or towne enterdyted ones yerely haue power to open the Churche dorys there ſo that Dyuyne ſeruyce ſolempnely may be ſayd / curſyd people by name put our / and dede bodyes in the Churchyerde to be buryed / And tho that ſhuld do open penaūce that day ſhalbe releſyd & ſpared. Alſo all bretherne & ſuſterne / whiche ſhall gyue to ye ſayd place certeyne quantyte of theyr goodes & yerely pay to the Brecherns or proctours of the ſayde hous. And in theyr dyenge bequech or aſſygne ony goodes to them / may cheſe yerely to them an able and diſcrete Confeſſour whiche may aſſoyle them plenarly of all ſynnes of the whiche they be verrey contryte and confeſſed / except ſuche as be reſeruyd onely to the courte of Rome / whiche be only .vi. caſes cōteyned in theſe .ii. verſes. Percutit incendit falſ at violat fluit a • nus / perticipat papa ſex ſolis caſibus iſtis. The vnderſtondynge wherof is this. Percutit / that is to ſey he that ſtrykyth a preeſt or a clerke greuouſly. Incendit / he that wilfully & marycyouſly ſetteth any Towne / cytie / or houſe on fyer & ther vpon is denouncyd & a curſed. Falſat / he that counterfaytyth the Popes bullys or letters. Violat / he that brekyth any churche & robbyth the ſame & ther vpon is denounced a curſed by his ordynary. Fluit: Annus / he that is acurſed by the Popes legat & ſo ſtondith by the ſpace of one hole yere. Participat / that is to ſey a Clarke commynynge Facultye to aſſoyle all Synnes excepte .vi. in dyuyne ſeruyſe wetyngly & wylfully with a man that is accurſed of the Pope hym ſelfe euery man beynge in any of theſe .vi. caſes muſt go to Rome for abſolucyon in all other caſys they may be Aſſoyled by this pryuylege.

¶ Alſo the ſayd Confeſſoure may diſpence with them of all vowes made the whiche they may not cōuenyenely nor profitably kepe excepte onely the vowe of Iheruſalem & the holy croſſe. Alſo eu • ry brother ſhall haue his letter or wrytynge of the ſayd Fraternyte & his ſepulture ſhal not be denyed hym what maner deth he dyeth or deceſyth but if he be acurſed by name by ye cēſur • of holy churche.

¶ Alſo our holy father Bonyface the .ix. of that name ſomtyme Pope of Rome to all theym repentaunt and ſhryuen that in the Feſtis vii. yeres & .vii. lentes in euery prīcipall feeſt. of the Natiuite / and Circumſiſion of our lorde Iheſu criſte / twelfe daye / paſche day / Aſcenſion daye / Corpus x • i day / whytſon daye / Natyuyte / Annunciacion / Puryfycacyon / and Aſſumpcion of our Lady / Alſo the natyuyte of ſeynt Iohū Baptyſte the appoſtles / Peter and Poule / the Dedicacyon of the ſayde Churche of ſeynt Thomas / alſo the feſtis of his tranſlacyon & paſſyon / or martyrdome / all halowen day▪ F • rthermore by the vtas of the ſayde Natyuite of criſte / the Epiphanie / Paſche / Aſcencion / Corpus x • i wytſondaye the Natyuyte and Aſſumpcion of our Lady / ſeynt Iohn̄ Baptyſte the appoſtles Peter / & Poule / and by ſyx dayes next after wytſondaye deuoutly vyſyteth • erely the ſame place of ſeynt Thomas / aforeſayd in eche of the ſayd feſtyuall dayes .vii. yeres: & .vii. • entes▪
〈◊〉 eche of the ſayd vtas▪ & .vii. dayes .C. dayes of pardon of penaunce enioyned marcyfully he hath releſyd.

¶ Alſo our holy father 〈◊〉 the ſeconde to all very repentaunte and ſhryuen that deuoutly vyſet the houſe and hoſpytall of ſeynte vii. yeres & .vii. lētes in certayne teweſdaies. thomas of 〈…〉 from 〈…〉 vnto ye vtas of Eſter &. • iii. dayes nexte before Eſter daye / And alſo euery day within y•
• as of y•
〈◊〉 of y• paſſ in & trāſla •• ō of ſeynt Thomas aforeſayd or by hymſelfe or ony other gyue ony thyn •• of cherytable 〈…〉
• foreſayd .vii. yeres and .vii. • entes of penaunce enioyned marcyfully hath releſyd for 〈…〉

¶ Alſo our holy 〈◊〉 Pau • us y• ſecōde to all tho y•
〈…〉 y• Cha • ell of our lady wt in yt ſayd churche 〈…〉
• . • eres and .v. 〈◊〉 . was & the • g • ue o ••
••• eſſe to y• cōſer •••
〈…〉
